children.subject: Thanks for your response but I definitely don't think I'd be able to handle that workload and do well as those are three heavy techs.
I'd recommend dropping Data8 and 16B and trying to do 170/61C then.

I’d disagree - I purposely spaced out 61c and 170 and I think it was a good decision. A lot of my friends who were taking both at the same time did not like both classes together, especially when 61c had projects due on the same day as 170 problem sets (which have been every week historically)
If it were me in this situation I think I would drop Data 8 and do 170, 61C, 16B.

history.content:
I'd do the first one since you want to recruit. You can take CS61c with along with another tech during Spring. I heard CS61c isn't exactly necessary for CS186 so you can do both concurrently

EDIT: Same applies for 169 - you don’t need 61c for that class at all.
I'd do the first one since you want to recruit. You can take CS61c with along with another tech during Spring. I heard CS61c isn't exactly necessary for CS186 so you can do both concurrently

Hi all,

I'm trying to choose between these two schedules: 

170, EE16B, Data 8.

61C, EE16B, Data 8. 

I'm going to be a first semester junior, and I want to take 61C to get my lower divs out of way because It's a pre req for classes that I want to take such as 186, 162, and 169, and I feel like I don't have much time with only 4 semesters left so I was thinking it would be good to get my lower divs done asap since I feel like I'm kinda behind everyone else.

On the other hand, I heard 170 is super important for interviews and I'm planning to be recruiting in the fall and spring for internships. I could take both and drop Data 8, but I don't think I'd be able to manage the workload of both along with EE16B. So should I prioritize finishing my lower divs first or take 170 to help with recruiting? Sorry for the long post I'm just kinda torn.
history.subject: Should I take 61C or 170 next semester?
